attributes.action: I want the mandatory tv licence in September to be abolished.
attributes.background: Come September 1 2016 you will be required by law to purchase a television licence, regardless of how you watch - this includes YouTube and BBC iPlayer etc.
attributes.additional_details:
From the TV licence website - 

No matter what device you use, you must be covered by a TV Licence if you watch or record live TV. This includes:
TV sets
Laptops and desktop computers
Tablets, mobile phones, satnavs and other portable devices
Digital boxes (PVRs), satellite and cable, e.g. Freeview, Freesat, Sky, Virgin Media, BT Vision, YouView, Apple TV, Chromecast, Roku and Amazon Fire TV
Games consoles
DVD, Blu-ray and VHS recorders

http://www.tvlicensing.co.uk/check-if-you-need-one

attributes.action: Trident to be removed from Scotland and renewed in England
attributes.background: Trident is not welcome in Scotland and rejected by Scottish MPs, if English MPs vote for the renewal of WMD then it should be done in England and not Scotland where it is heavily opposed.

attributes.action: Fertility treatment, artificial insemination and IVF free for lesbian couples
attributes.background: It is wrong to make gay couples pay to start a family. It costs around Â£1500 per try and not every gay couple can afford this. Lesbians and gay couples should be provided with free fertility treatment. They want to start a family but cannot afford this. They should not be punished for being gay.

attributes.action: Improve access to NHS dental services in Cornwall and Devon
attributes.background: According to Cornwall's NHS Dental Helpline, there is a six- to 12-month wait just to get on an NHS dentist's books in Cornwall. In late 2015 there were 7,500 people on the waiting list. We desperately need better access to NHS treatment as few people can afford private dental fees.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.piratefm.co.uk/news/latest-news/1834169/7500-wait-for-a-dentist-in-cornwall/

attributes.action: A General Election or another EU Referendum
attributes.background: Considering the very misleading campaign to leave the EU, the fallout we have witnessed since the now obviously flawed results and the fact that nobody in power seems to be acknowledging these issues, we the undersigned demand that the fixed term rules of Parliament be put aside and call an election
attributes.additional_details: If Parliament are not willing to allow a general election at this volatile and very confusing time, then at least pay attention to the facts surrounding the EU Referendum, that the results were largely due to flawed campaigns, lies and manipulations.  Many people, an estimated 7% according to one survey would vote differently 'now they know' the facts.  A referendum should not be actioned on results garnered through false information and scare tactics.  Election, or another referendum is needed.

attributes.action: Mandate our EU representatives veto further EU expansion instead of Brexit
attributes.background: Much of the leave campaign support seemed to surround the potential for Turkey and other countries joining the EU. Rather than leaving the EU, we should mandate that we use our power of veto to ensure that this does not happen.
attributes.additional_details: I have watched countless TV programmes interviewing the supporters and voters of the leave  campaign. This appears to be the main issue, with many saying that the migrants that are here should be allowed to stay. By mandating our power of veto, this would facilitate the UK staying in the EU, with the benefits it brings and stop the EU from expanding by increasing the member countries.

attributes.action: Article 50 Lisbon treaty can only be invoked by 2/3 's majority of MP's
attributes.background:
The recent referendum showed different needs across the UK. 
As a parliamentary democracy we trust in elected MP's to make decisions on our behalf. 
Only a plan that a significant majority of MP's can support will re-unite the UK
attributes.additional_details:
There is currently no plan. It is the job of parliament  to ensure 
that before article 50 is invoked there is robust, coherent and competent plan in place that is in the interests of the UK as a whole and will deliver clear advantages and benefits to the UK over the current status quo as a member of the European Union.

attributes.action:
Outlaw Investor-State Dispute Settlements
(Investors Suing the U.K. Government)
attributes.background: Investor-State Dispute Settlement clauses in trade deals provide a means for foreign investors to sue governments for policies which harm their profits. If successful, taxpayer money is used to pay damages to them. A government can thus be more beholden to corporations than the public they serve.
attributes.additional_details:
The TTIP trade agreement contains one such ISDS clause. The Trans Pacific Partnership (TPP) and Trade In Services Agreement (TISA) have one also. 
Secretly negotiated, they ensure foreign corps are able to sue 2/3 of the world's governments and block trade with the emerging economies of China, Brazil, Russia, India and S. Africa. 
Examples:
Vattenfall vs Germany for phasing out nuclear energy ($3.7bn)
Veolia vs Egypt (introducing a minimum wage)
B.A.T. vs Australia (tobacco advertising laws)

attributes.action: Make non-payment of rent a criminal offence
attributes.background: Landlords need protection from unscrupulous people who refuse to pay their rent knowing the law is in favour of the tenant. Not only will they  continue to live rent free sometimes for up to a year but they will often trash the property rendering it uninhabitable and then move doing the same again.
attributes.additional_details: Unscrupulous tenants deliberately fail to pay their rent knowing that the legal processes of eviction are long and tedious,They take advantage of this often causing serious damage to a property while the landlord is waiting for legal processes to take effect. These types often cause conflict with neighbours and no-one can take them to task over it. When they are eventually evicted they repeat the process elsewhere  without paying a penny towards their debt or being held accountable for damage.

attributes.action: Make finance a part of the GCSE Maths curriculum.
attributes.background: Children are leaving school into a world they are not aware of financially. Too many young people are taking out Loans and Credit Cards without fully understanding how that will affect them later in life. Make finance a part of GCSE maths and teach students about loans, mortgages and credit cards
attributes.additional_details: I took out a Â£5000 loan when I was 18. I was in then in a job that enabled me to repay the debt comfortably. Since then I lost that job and have been financially crippled since then. I can no longer get a mobile phone contract, I find it hard to get a private tenancy agreement. None of this or the consequences was I informed of during school. Make information about loans, credit cards and mortgages compulsory in GCSE maths to better equip students for the real world.

attributes.action: Hold a general election in 2017 under proportional representation
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum, political and economic chaos has thrown the UK into uncertainty. An unelected prime minister will be appointed and turmoil in party politics shows politicians to have a lack of value in democracy. FPTP is a dated mechanism and is not representative of the people.

attributes.action: Add a capture code to the government petition site to prevent false signatures.
attributes.background: It is now common knowledge that the petition calling for a second referendum has been compromised. A hacker group is using a computerised bot to generate signatures. This petition should now be made null and void and all future petitions should have a captcha code, proving the signature is real
attributes.additional_details: There should also be a way of cross referencing the post code used, with the electoral register, to prevent miscreants from passing their post code for use to all and sundry.

attributes.action: Motorcycle Instructors to have a Disclosure and Barring Service check
attributes.background:
It is not compulsory for Motorcycle Instructors to have a Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check. Previously known as a CRB check.

From the age of 16 you are eligible for Compulsive Basic Training (on a scooter) which means you can have 1:1 tuition from an approved Motorcycle Instructor.
attributes.additional_details:
A teaching profession which involves contact with young people should have DBS check as a mandatory requirement to safeguard the general public.  NHS workers, teachers and approved driving instructors (ADI) all have a DBS check.

The Driving Standards and Vehicles Agency uses the loose term of 'Fit and Proper' to approve a Motorcycle Instructor. Those individuals who have a previous criminal record, or spent time in prison, can still become or continue their role as Motorcycle Instructor.

attributes.action: Make Blue Badges Available to People With Mental Health Conditions.
attributes.background:
Under current regulations mental health conditions such as agoraphobia, anxiety and panic disorder are not accepted as valid reasons for needing a Blue Badge.
These conditions can be equally and sometimes more debilitating than a physical disability and it is discriminatory to exclude them.
attributes.additional_details:
Blue Badges, which allow people with certain disabilities to park closer to services, are only available to those with a physical disability. Those suffering from the above conditions are not able to apply for a badge unless they receive the higher rate of the mobility component of DLA.
The exception is if a person is unable to follow a familiar route without aid.
Mental health conditions can affect mobility and be extremely disabling, preventing a full life. Blue Badges could help with this.

attributes.action: Can you please just raise the speed limit to 80 as 70 is ancient.
attributes.background: I want this petition to go forward as I can not see the point of a 70mph speed limit when on the motorway it feels dangerous as cars fly past well over that and I do not want to break the law to maintain a safe flow of traffic .there is no money for better policing and you cannot fine everybody
attributes.additional_details: Other countries as Czech Republic Romania and Germany all have higher speed limits and this would lower intimidating driving

attributes.action: Keep the UK in the single market and continue to allow free movement of people
attributes.background:
On 23 June 2016 the people of the UK decided that European integration had gone too far.

However we believe that the UK must continue to be part of the single market and continue to allow free movement of people.
attributes.additional_details:
The single market has obviously benefitted the UK economically. Freedom of movement, one of the four freedoms of the single market, is also a basic human right.

Immigration to the UK has had a positive effect on our country. Keeping the borders open means people can continue to work and contribute in this great country and make it even better. And the people of the UK can continue to travel and contribute in the rest of Europe.

attributes.action: Make future UK referendum results require a majority of 60%
attributes.background: Referendums are called by the UK government on matters of major constitutional change. Any major change from the status quo should have the backing of at least 60% of those who vote in each referendum.
attributes.additional_details: Recent referendums have demonstrated the strongly devisive nature of proposed major changes to people's lives, especially when the result is close to an even split. Having to reach a qualified majority of 60% in any UK referendum would help ensure that changes are more widely accepted amongst the electorate.

attributes.action: End Taxpayer Bail-outs of Banks by removing limitation of shareholder liability.
attributes.background: Between 2007 and 2010 the British Taxpayer bailed out the banks and bankers with cash and guarantees totalling Â£1,162 BILLION, equivalent to almost 3 times the total NHS budget for the same 4-year period! (Source: NAO; https://www.nao.org.uk/highlights/taxpayer-support-for-uk-banks-faqs/)
attributes.additional_details: The remedy is to ensure that shareholders are on the hook for all the banks' liabilities without a taxpayer safety net. They will then hold bank directors and management to account and monitor risk to prevent recurrences of such disasters. To achieve this, Parliament should remove shareholders' limited liability in banks (and any other business deemed too big to fail), so that shareholders, not taxpayers, are liable for all the banks' liabilities. There can be no reasonable objection to this.

attributes.action: Reform our parliamentary system in the wake of the UK's vote for independence.
attributes.background: One argument put forward by the Leave campaign was that the EU was undemocratic. This message undoubtedly struck a chord with many voters who feel disenfranchised. Yet Brexit will not solve this since our parliamentary system remains inherently unrepresentative for the following reasons:
attributes.additional_details:
- The House of Lords is unelected.
- First Past the Post is unrepresentative. UKIP (3881129) and Greens (1157613) needed vastly more voters per MP than Labour (40290) or Conservatives (34245) (https://www.opendemocracy.net/ourkingdom/liam-anderson/voters-per-mp-why-first-past-post-failed).

The following should happen before the next election:
- The House of Lords be replaced with an elected Second Chamber.
- A debate (and possible referendum) over the best voting system (PR, STV, AV+, FPTP).

attributes.action: Remove the titles Mrs, Miss and Ms from all government forms.
attributes.background: Titles for women are sexist and discriminatory, and provide marital status information about them that men do not have to divulge. Even having the Ms option gives some people a preconception about that person. All titles fields should be removed from document and computer forms.

attributes.action: Make councils turn redundant grace space they own into wildflower meadows.
attributes.background: Councils own lot's of patches of land next to roads, buildings  on housing estates etc; all that grows there is grass; it looks boring and the councils probably spend a fortune cutting the grass in the warmer months. Meadows are decreasing they need some help.

attributes.action:
Give Foster Carers employee rights. 
Why do they have to be self employed
attributes.background:
why is it Foster Carers Are forced to be self employed in  a highly regulated profession. Local Authorities and Independent fostering agencies can get away without offering their foster Carers employment rights. 
 Foster Carers can only work for one IFA or LA they are not independent contractors

attributes.action: Make the day after Remembrance Sunday a Bank Holiday to honour our Armed Forces
attributes.background: The day after Remembrance Sunday should be made a Bank Holiday every year to honour Britainâs war dead and Armed Forces. Many other countries pay tribute to their Armed Forces with a national holiday including the United States, Canada, Russia, France and Israel.

attributes.action: Stop the deportation of the Zeilsdorf Family from Laggan.
attributes.background: The family are waiting for imminent deportation as they have failed to meet the criteria of their Entrepreneur Visa by employing 2 people in their tiny shop and coffee bothy in Laggan. They do employ 1, they have 3 children, and take care of the local rural community by providing a valuable service.
attributes.additional_details: They are being forced to leave before they can sell. There's every chance that the business will not continue and the area will lose it's shop. Other similar services are tens of miles away. Their children are Scottish, they employ someone, and they make regular visits to local elderly and house bound people in the community as Jason was a Pastor. It is not the Highlands, Scotland or Scottish people who don't want and them; it is just the Home Office. We NEED them - sign  to keep the Zeilsdorfs.

attributes.action: Change laws on house buying/selling make "accepted offer" legally binding
attributes.background: Currently there is no law or anything legally binding once an offer is accepted, if the buyer pulls out at any time. Which can cause the loss of survey fees and solicitors fees to the buyer. An there is nothing the buyer can do to recoup these costs or any impact on the seller currently.
attributes.additional_details: If this happens a few times this can result in the buyer losing thousands of pounds. A house is one of the biggest expenses and outgoings we incur in our lives. With this uncertainly in can put new buyers off as a house in not guaranteed currently until contracts are completed. An existing home movers off as they just can't take the chance of losing that additional money. Plus the seller and pull out currently with no impact to themselves currently.

attributes.action: Change the law on court child access fees
attributes.background: Every time a parent goes against the court order, that parent has to pay Â£220 to go back to court. It's ridiculous the other parent going against the courts order for access should be charged this fee.
attributes.additional_details: If the parent who went against a court access order was charged the fee or had to re pay the Â£220 to the aggrieved parent. It's totally wrong that the aggrieved parent has to keep paying this money.  Maybe if the other parent had to pay it, they would not go against court order in the first place.

attributes.action: Introduce medical intervention sooner for those suffering with Anorexia Nervosa
attributes.background: Medical intervention should begin sooner to prevent a patients rapid deterioration of health. Counselling as a first form of treatment is not at all useful on its own if the patient is suffering malnourishment. Their brain lacks ability to concentrate and withhold useful advice and information.
attributes.additional_details: Medical and counselling services should work hand in hand to ensure fast diagnosis and early intervention. Medical help to prevent extreme rapid deterioration of an individual health is vital. Much to the individuals refusal and disapproval this should be pressed or encouraged to help the recovery process begin as soon as possible. Putting off recovery will only prolong the suffering and tormenting thoughts, allowing them to become the only way in life like a 'voice' that must be abided by.

attributes.action: Impose stiffer penalties for hand held mobile phone use in vehicles.
attributes.background:
Use of such phones is not diminishing . Evidence from police force videos shows drivers talking and texting or viewing smartphone content. 
Phone logs time stamp usage
Current penalties are not fit for purpose. 
The consequences of accidents caused by such drivers are totally unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
A Zero Tolerance deterrent is urgently needed to make the results of a conviction more meaningful to the driver and on a par with the offence of drink-driving.  

- An immediate suspension of the driving licence upon apprehension

- On conviction, automatic 12 month disqualification, 6 points on the    licence and Â£1000 fine, plus seizure of the mobile device.

- If convicted a second time, the courts should be allowed to impose unlimited disqualification, fine or even imprisonment.

attributes.action: Bring the child victims of the Syrian conflict to the UK and Europe.
attributes.background: Every day for the past five years a child has lost its life due to the conflict. The world has stood by for way to long and watched children pay the price for adult wars! it is my belief we have a OBLIGATION to rescue and protect as many of these children as we can.
attributes.additional_details: It is only since the outrage over Aylan Kurdi and now Omran Daqneesh the world has woken up and realized what the Syrian people have been dealing with as daily life for five whole years. It is in my belief we should ALL be doing what we can to evacuate these children and home them in safe countries. They do not deserve to pay the price for adult wars and this MUST be stopped! There must be relief provided and as many children evacuated as possible. Thank you all for your support.

attributes.action: Give the NHS a percentage of tuition fees from all HE health careers courses.
attributes.background: The NHS would benefit from extra funding. They should be given a percentage of tuition fees from all health careers courses. Students studying these courses should oblige as the NHS is the future for the majority of their career. The extra funds would help with the upkeep and development of the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS is suffering from a lack of funding and a lack of staff. If they were to recieve a percentage of student tuition fees (only from health related courses) then there would be a boost in funding. It could also be an incentive to encourage more people to study these courses and eventually work for the NHS, as they would feel as though there University costs have contributed to their future career on another level.

attributes.action: Increase the Carer's Allowance to Â£80 per week, from Â£62.10 per week
attributes.background: There are an estimated 6.5 million carers in the UK, meaning that 1 in 10 people have caring duties. Unpaid carers save the UK government Â£119 billion per year, more than is spent on the NHS. To receive the carers allowance, you must care for 35 hours a week, when many care for 100 hours or more.
attributes.additional_details: Working up to 100 hours, the Carer's Allowance equates to 62p per hour, in contrast to the minimum wage of Â£7.20 per hour. The burden of caring is great, with 625,000 carers suffering from mental or physical illnesses - around the population of Glasgow. The problem will only get worse with 6,000 people becoming carers every day - these people need help now.

attributes.action: Introducing funding to help those with mental health issues.
attributes.background: There are many people in the UK that are experiencing mental health issues. This is a problem as people are still suffering from theses issues and not had the support needed. This has caused people to be in a worse situation than they would of if the had the support in the first place.
attributes.additional_details: This is important to me as i am experiencing this myself. I am wanting to change this  and stop making people waiting for professional help and get the qualified people in. By raising awareness we can make those vulnerable people and their friends and families feel they are not alone and make more peoples lives better. This can be done with more advertisement, more qualified professionals to set up more social action projects and one to one appointments.

attributes.action: Stop Privatisation of Lancaster Post Office
attributes.background: Lancaster Post Office has become a historic local institution providing a wide range of services. Relocating it could reduce the service offered to customers in the long run, make access difficult for the disabled and the elderly and would be unsuitable for people who don't like crowded spaces.
attributes.additional_details: The current post office is spacious which enables it to offer a wide range of services, it is on the ground floor, very close to town centre, is a couple of minutes walk from a large car park on Dallas Road and is next door to the local Royal Mail Delivery Office. W.H Smiths would offer non of these advantages except the fact it is in town centre because there is no nearby parking and having postal vans would have to go through a pedestrianised area.

attributes.action: Prevent the sale of ARM Holdings to Softbank
attributes.background: The government should prevent the sale of ARM, the biggest and most successful British technology company to the Japanese company Softbank.  With designs used in over 90% of devices, the idea that only another company can support its growth is invalid.
attributes.additional_details:
If the government truly believes in businesses that can compete in the world then it must realise it takes decades to develop companies such as ARM and coming under foreign ownership when not needed is only ultimately strategically beneficial for the foreign company and bad for national self-esteem.  

The sale of ARM will represent the end of real British involvement in any significant way in the ever-growing, ever important technology sector.

attributes.action: Allow CCW in the UK for self defence
attributes.background: With violent crime at a whole time high in the UK.   And with the major threat of another terror attack,  it is a human right to be able to defend ourselves against this situation.  It is time for the right to CCW. (Conceal carry )   gun ownership for self defense can work in the UK.  Safely
attributes.additional_details: People always say the uk doesn't want to decommissioning another America when it comes to guns,  the media only report the criminal aspect of guns, they never report on the lives saved by the gun,  the crime stopped by the gun,   guns were banned after the Dunblane killings, but think.  If the kids were killed by a kitchen knife. Would the government have banned all kitchen knives, no..  gun ownership can work for self defense in the UK.  It is YOUR  human right to be able to protect yourself

attributes.action: New Prime Minister Theresa May suspend HS2 until Brexit negotiations complete
attributes.background:
Economic case for HS2 can't be justified until all Brexit negotiations complete & or 2nd referendum.
Under Brexit if carried out, London may no longer retain hub status. If Scotland negotiates to remain in EU, strong economic case for HS2 Phase1 connecting northern England with Edinburgh & Glasgow
attributes.additional_details:
Assumptions of HS2 economic projections are based on London being at focal point of connection between UK & other European countries. Logic may now not hold true.
Until full scale of Brexit negotiations are known economic case for HS2 is tenuous.
If after Brexit negotiations on UK leaving EU, Scotland negotiates to remain part of EU, perfectly conceivable Edinburgh & Glasgow could become significant economic hubs in their own right. Trade is more likely to flow via Scotland in such a scenario.

attributes.action: Change the gambling age to 21+ now!
attributes.background: With more and more gambling sites appearing, new bookies opening daily, and the sponsorships of Gambling companies appearing all over, and around our sport teams stadiums and merchandise. Our younger generation is constantly force fed and reminded of these companies.
attributes.additional_details: With a National Lottery ticket you must be 16+, Any bookies and/or Casino 18+, I feel if we postpone the ability to gamble, this will have massive benefits to the younger generation as they'll have a much better understanding of money and it's worth at the age of 21, as opposed to 16/18. Let's take control of early addiction, and encourage our own self-success.

attributes.action: Move Cannabis to Class C and move it from a schedule 1 drug
attributes.background: Both of the current class and scheduling of cannabis are out of date, unscientific, completely against all evidence, have created enormous harm to society and has held back medical advances for over 45 years.
attributes.additional_details: The reclassification of cannabis from Class C to Class B was done as part of a deal made by Gordon Brown and the Daily Mail editor. This was done against the findings, research and recommendation of the ACMD. The schedule 1 status means that the drug has no medical value. This is completely wrong as it was still being prescribed as a medicine in the UK until 1971. Over the last 20 years there have been on average 2 published studies per day on medical cannabis. People are suffering as a result.

attributes.action: make a new law to force landlords to allow pets in rented properties
attributes.background: all pets deserve a loving home and this is being taken away by landlords refusing to allow pets so I ask all animal lovers to support this and get the government to make a new law forcing landlords to allow pets in rented properties

attributes.action: Fly British flags in major cities
attributes.background:
I would like to see as in so many other countries all public buildings flying the Union Jack, the National Flag ( St Georges cross for England and either the county or city flag.

Many other countries do this, I think the Uk should too. 

For example
attributes.additional_details:
I would like to see as in so many other countries all public buildings flying the Union Jack, the National Flag ( St Georges cross for England and either the county or city flag.

Many other countries do this, I think the Uk should too. 

For example

attributes.action: Work with the other 27 states to reform the EU to an acceptable standard for all
attributes.background: It is not mandatory to act in accordance with a referendum. In the interests of peace, humanity and national security the Government should disregard the recent result, NOT trigger Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty but work with the 27 states to reform the EU in a way that is acceptable to all members
attributes.additional_details:
The first incarnation of the European Union was formed in 1957 by 6 countries, previously in conflict, to show allegiance to each other and prevent the further outbreak of war within Europe. 

On 23rd June 2016, the UK voted in a referendum to leave the EU and in the proceeding 5 days witnessed several disturbing acts of unrest and general tension as a result.

attributes.action: Don't implement GCSE exam 9-1 grades, instead have A*, A, B*, B, C*, C, D, E, F.
attributes.background: The justification for swapping from A*-G to 9-1 can be found on the gov.uk webpage in additional details. After reading it I hope you agree it will just serve to cause massive confusion for employers & students. The system I propose keeps the the new 9 grades but is comparable to existing ones.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/setting-standards-for-new-gcses-in-2017

http://www.theguardian.com/education/2015/jun/02/ofqual-survey-finds-wide-confusion-and-doubts-about-gcse-and-a-level-changes

https://www.tes.com/news/school-news/breaking-news/teachers-confused-over-new-numerical-gcse-grading-system

attributes.action: If Brexit happens. All previous EU spending should be forced to go to the NHS.
attributes.background: The Leave campaign made promises that the money spent in the EU would go to the NHS. They should be forced to up keep that promise.

attributes.action: Control the right to vote, by a political knowledge test.
attributes.background:
Voters have no political knowledge to vote fairly.
It is a duty of every voter to know the theory behind every voting and base the opinion and vote on true facts and figures. 
To help the nation understand the politics and consequences of choices, 'right to vote' control is urgently needed.

attributes.action: We the people of Britain demand more funds to strengthen the NHS.
attributes.background:
As we know the wonderful NHS is failing the people of Britain due to big"cuts" and we stress that more cuts will end the NHS and certainly lead to a weaker and unhealthy Britain. 
I call on the government to put more effort and funds into the NHS to strengthen its weakness. Who is with me on this.
attributes.additional_details: Online researchers have carried out a questionnaire on the failure of the NHS the outcome is shameful, Also the amount of hospitals closing in Britain is dreadful this is due to "Cuts" and lack of funds, and the taxpayers pay in to receive a good strong Heath system. It's time to strengthen are NHS and fast, we the people of Britain demand more funding NOW! Number of deaths that occurred under the  conservative government is very high.

attributes.action: A life-time ban from politics, and punishment, for MPs that renege on promises.
attributes.background: We propose a life ban from politics for MPs who do not enact all manifesto promises - or those implied in slogans.  Also a fine or imprisonment for 'perjury to abuse public trust'. Party funds used for such campaigns should be forcibly recovered to fund a watchdog body against future such abuses.
attributes.additional_details: Whatever you voted, the decision to leave the EU is a chance for Britain to fix its democracy.  In elections, and now in the referendum, politicians make campaign promises in order to win votes, only to u-turn or deny making those promises. It mocks the principles of democracy. Now is a chance to write into law an insurance against such deception. This law would put an end to 'career politics' and remind all elected representatives that they work for the electorate, not their own agendas.

attributes.action: Impose a cap on tuition fees at Â£9000 for EU students until 2020.
attributes.background: Due to the result of the recent EU referendum, many EU students who want to study in Britain in coming years now face prices of up to Â£20,000 as they will be deemed as international students.  To make it fair for these students, we are proposing capping tuition fees until 2020.

attributes.action: Make MP's send yearly report to their constituents.
attributes.background: In a time of information and misinformation I propose that MP's send a report to each of their constituents outlying which bills they have voted for, against or abstained. Their attendance in office and parliament and their expenses.
attributes.additional_details: As public servants and representatives of the people, MP's should send information of what they have voted for (on our behalf), so we can decide if we choose to keep them in office. I am aware that this information is in the public domain, but is not readily available to us all. In a society where we celebrate  democracy, the MP's should be happy for us to see what they are doing and allow us to celebrate their achievements by voting them in next time.

attributes.action: Legal minimum age to enter into marriage in UK to change from 16 to 18 years.
attributes.background:
Legal minimum age to enter into a marriage in England and Wales is 16 years, although this requires parental consent if a participant is under 18 years.
Changing the law to 18 years will have a huge positive impact on arranged or forced marriages here in England and Wales as some are forced at 16.
attributes.additional_details: When a child turns 18 they are expected to start making their own decisions and be treated like adults. They are obliged to take responsibility for their own lives, so why is the legal age of marriage in England and Wales 16 when they are still considered children? This is common in Asian communities where young 16 years old's are expected to marry and take on responsibility they are not ready for.  Does a 16 year old understand what marriage is at that age? Are they ready for this commitment?

attributes.action: Require all universities by law to consider applications anonymously.
attributes.background: Recent studies have shown that perfectly able candidates are not being offered the same opportunities due to 'name discrimination'. This can be in the form of prejudice surrounding names related to ethnic origin or even gender discrimination within big companies that would like more male employees.
attributes.additional_details:
-Dr. Colin Holbrook, a research scientist at the UCLA Center for Behavior, Evolution, and Culture has recently done a study showing that names have an influence on job interviews and university places in terms of race and gender.
-By making it law for organisations such as UCAS to require anonymous applications it will hopefully prevent discrimination against those with ethnic-sounding or just clear gender identifiable names, based on stereotypes.
